licenses.title: Licenses
licenses.description: Manage software licenses across all providers
licenses.confirmRemoveFromProvider: Are you sure you want to remove this user from the provider? This action cannot be undone.
licenses.allMatchedToHRIS: All active licenses are matched to HRIS
licenses.removeFromProviderDescription: This will remove {count} user(s) from their provider system via API.
licenses.actionsPerformed: The following actions will be performed:
licenses.usersRemovedFromProvider: Users will be removed from the external provider (e.g., Cursor team)
licenses.licensesDeletedFromDB: Licenses will be deleted from this database
licenses.onlyCursorSupports: Only Cursor licenses support remote removal ({count} of {total} selected)
licenses.bulkDeleteDescription: This will delete {count} license(s) from the local database.
licenses.doesNotRemoveFromProvider: This does NOT remove users from the external provider systems
licenses.mayReappear: Licenses may reappear after the next sync if users still exist in the provider
licenses.useRemoveInstead: Use "Remove from Provider" to actually revoke access
licenses.bulkUnassignDescription: This will unassign {count} license(s) from their employees.
licenses.removeEmployeeAssociation: Remove the employee association from the selected licenses
licenses.markAsUnassignedInSystem: Mark the licenses as "Unassigned" in the system
licenses.licensesRemainInDB: The licenses remain in the database and users remain in the provider
licenses.allLicensesMatchedToHRIS: All active licenses are matched to HRIS
licenses.linkToEmployeeDescription: Link this license to an employee by matching the username. This creates an external account link.
licenses.noSuggestionsFound: No matching employees found based on username similarity
licenses.failedToLink: Failed to link license to employee
licenses.searchEmployeeToLink: Search for an employee to link

providers.title: Providers
providers.credentialsDescription: API credentials are stored securely encrypted. Only fill in fields you want to update.
providers.editCredentialsDescription: Leave fields empty to keep existing values. Only filled fields will be updated.
providers.leaveEmptyToKeep: Leave empty to keep current value
providers.enterAtLeastOneCredential: Please enter at least one credential field
providers.editDescription: Update settings. Leave credentials empty to keep current values.
providers.logoFormats: PNG, JPG, SVG or WebP. Max 2MB.
providers.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete {name}? All associated licenses will be removed. This cannot be undone.
providers.manualProviderNote: After creating the provider, you can add license keys or seats and configure pricing in the Pricing tab.
providers.configureProvider: Connect your first provider to start tracking licenses
providers.pricingSavedApplied: Pricing saved and applied to licenses
providers.individualPricingSaved: Individual pricing saved and applied to licenses
providers.enterLicenseKey: Please enter at least one license key
providers.licenseTypeRequired: License type and total seats are required
providers.seatBasedDescription: Seat-based licenses are tied to users. License-based licenses can be transferred between users.
providers.deleteProviderWarning: Deleting this provider will remove all associated licenses.
providers.confirmDeleteProvider: Delete provider "{name}" and all its licenses?
providers.paymentMethodDescription: Assign a payment method for billing this provider's licenses.
providers.syncToDiscover: Sync the provider to discover license types
providers.licensePackagesDescription: Track purchased seat packages and their utilization
providers.addPackageToTrack: Add a package to track seat utilization
providers.orgLicenseDescription: Organization-wide licenses not tied to individual users (e.g., storage, capacity)
providers.uploadDocumentsNote: Upload contracts, invoices, or other documents
providers.deleteConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete {email}? This cannot be undone.
providers.configureAsServiceAccount: Configure {email} as a service account. Service accounts are intentionally not linked to HRIS employees.
providers.serviceAccountNamePlaceholder: e.g., Backup Service, CI/CD Bot, Shared Mailbox
providers.serviceAccountNameDescription: A descriptive name for this service account
providers.responsiblePersonDescription: The person responsible for this service account
providers.addToGlobalList: Add to Global Service Account List
providers.globalPatternDescription: This email will be added to the global service account list. All licenses matching this email will automatically be marked as service accounts.
providers.configureAsAdminAccount: Configure {email} as an admin account. This is a privileged account used for administrative tasks.
providers.adminAccountNamePlaceholder: e.g., Global Admin, Service Admin, IT Admin
providers.adminAccountNameDescription: A descriptive name for this admin account
providers.adminResponsibleDescription: The employee responsible for this admin account
providers.addToGlobalAdminList: Add to Global Admin Account List
providers.globalAdminPatternDescription: This email will be added to the global admin account list. All licenses matching this email will automatically be marked as admin accounts.
providers.addPackageDescription: Create a new license package with seat allocation and pricing.
providers.addOrgLicenseDescription: Add an organization-wide license that isn't tied to individual users.
providers.addLicenseDescription: Manually add a license for this provider.
providers.pageDescription: Manage HRIS and license provider integrations
providers.connectHiBobDescription: Connect HiBob to sync employee data
providers.connectHrisDescription: Connect your HRIS to sync employee data
providers.yearlyDividedNote: Yearly costs are divided by 12, quarterly by 3, perpetual/one-time show as €0/month.
providers.monthlyCalculationNote: The monthly cost shown on licenses is calculated from the billing cycle. Yearly costs are divided by 12, quarterly by 3, perpetual/one-time show as €0/month.
providers.individualPriceCalculationNote: The monthly cost per user is calculated as the sum of all their individual license prices. Yearly costs are divided by 12.
providers.setPricesDescription: Set prices for each license type. Prices will be applied to existing and new licenses.
providers.individualPricesNote: Or set individual prices per license type (overrides package pricing).

settings.backupInfoText: Exports all providers, licenses, employees and settings as an encrypted file.
settings.addPaymentMethodsNote: Add credit cards, bank accounts, or other payment methods
settings.leaveEmptyForDefault: Leave empty for default message template
settings.companyDomainsDescription: Configure your company email domains. Licenses assigned to users with external email addresses will be highlighted with a warning.
settings.slackDescription: Configure Slack integration to receive notifications about license changes, offboarded employees, and sync errors.
settings.backupInfoDescription: Exports all providers, licenses, employees and settings as an encrypted file.
settings.importWarningDescription: Importing will delete ALL existing data and replace it with the backup!

passwordPolicy.title: Password Policy
passwordPolicy.description: Configure password requirements for all user accounts. These settings apply to new passwords and password changes.

passwordPolicy.historyCountHint: Number of previous passwords that cannot be reused
passwordPolicy.maxFailedAttemptsHint: Failed login attempts before account lockout
passwordPolicy.lockoutDurationHint: Duration of account lockout after too many failed attempts
passwordPolicy.lengthWarningDescription: A minimum length of 16 characters or more is recommended for stronger security.

setup.authTokenHelp: Base64 encoded string of service_user_id:api_key for Basic Auth

setup.completeDescription: Your license management system is ready to use. We'll start syncing your data in the background.

errors.rateLimited: Too many requests. Please try again later.

validation.email: Please enter a valid email address

permissions: SCIM bridge token with full provisioning access
steps: 1. Log in to 1Password Business/Teams admin console
4. Generate a new SCIM bearer token
6. Save the bearer token securely - it cannot be viewed again
2. Create a new project or select existing
5. Copy the Client ID and Client Secret
6. Find Organization ID: Admin Console → Overview
7. Technical Account ID: Found in credential details
8. Ensure the integration has User Management admin role
6. Copy the API key immediately - it cannot be viewed again
7. Find Organization ID: Settings → Organization details
8. Admin Email: Your Atlassian admin account email

permissions: Team Admin API Key with member management access
steps: 1. Log in to Cursor as a Team Admin
4. Ensure Enterprise plan is active for full API access
5. Copy the API key and store it securely

permissions: SCIM API access (requires Business or Enterprise plan)
steps: 1. Log in to Figma as an Organization Admin
2. Go to Admin Settings → Login and provisioning → SCIM provisioning
4. Copy the token immediately - it cannot be viewed again
5. Go to Admin Settings → SAML SSO to find your Tenant ID
6. Note: SCIM requires Figma Business or Enterprise plan

permissions: read:org - Read organization and team membership
steps: 1. Go to GitHub → Settings → Developer settings → Personal access tokens
4. For Enterprise: use admin:org for seat counts
5. Copy the token and store securely
6. Organization name: your GitHub org slug (github.com/ORG_NAME)

permissions: Admin access token with read_api and read_user scopes
For self-hosted: Fetches all instance users automatically
steps: 1. Go to GitLab → Admin Area → Settings → Access Tokens
2. Create a new Admin Access Token
6. Server URL: Enter your GitLab server (e.g., gitlab.company.com)
Note: For self-hosted GitLab, all instance users are synced automatically
1. Go to Google Cloud Console → Create new project
3. Create Service Account with Domain-Wide Delegation
5. In Google Admin: Security → API controls → Domain-wide delegation
6. Add the Service Account client ID
8. Admin Email: A super admin email for impersonation

permissions: Access Token with write permissions (for role management)
Organization admin role (for email access with SSO)
steps: 1. Log in to Hugging Face as an organization admin
6. Organization: Your org name from the URL (huggingface.co/your-org)
Note: Email addresses require Team/Enterprise plan with SSO configured

permissions: API Token with employee read access
steps: 1. Log in to HiBob as Admin
2. Go to Settings → Integrations → Service Users
6. Copy the token - it cannot be retrieved later

permissions: API credentials with employee read access
steps: 1. Log in to Personio as Admin
2. Go to Settings → Integrations → API credentials
6. Copy the Client Secret - it cannot be viewed again

permissions: Organization API access with license management
steps: 5. The API key provides access to license assignments

permissions: Personal Access Token or Bot Token
steps: 1. Go to Mattermost → Account Settings → Security
3. For bot tokens: Integrations → Bot Accounts
4. System Admin role provides full user list access
5. Regular users may only see users in their teams
6. Server URL: Your Mattermost instance URL (e.g., https://mattermost.company.com)
1. Go to Azure Portal → Azure Active Directory
4. Note the Application (Client) ID and Tenant ID
6. API permissions → Add permission → Microsoft Graph

permissions: team:read - Read team and member information
steps: 1. Go to Miro → Profile Settings → Your apps
2. Create new app or use existing
6. Organization ID: Admin → Organization settings → ID
7. Enterprise plan required for organization-wide access

permissions: Admin API Key with organization member access
steps: 2. Click on your profile → Organization settings
4. Go to API keys → Create new secret key
5. You must be an Organization Owner to access member list
6. The Admin API provides access to:
1. Go to api.slack.com/apps → Create New App
4. OAuth & Permissions → Add Bot Token Scopes:
6. Copy Bot User OAuth Token (starts with xoxb-)
7. User Token (xoxp-) optional for additional access
3. Create an Admin API key (not a regular API key)
5. You must be an Organization owner/admin
6. Copy the key immediately - it cannot be viewed again
1. Go to Auth0 Dashboard → Applications → APIs
3. Go to Machine to Machine Applications tab
4. Authorize your app and select scopes:
6. Copy Domain, Client ID, and Client Secret
5. Keys are created automatically with your account
6. Master key has full access to all sub-accounts
1. Go to Zoom App Marketplace → Develop → Build App
3. Fill in app name and create the app
4. Copy the Account ID from app overview
6. Copy Client ID and Client Secret
